item.name: SQLServer:Access Methods: Forwarded Records/sec
item.description:
Number of records per second fetched through forwarded record pointers.
Количество записей, выбранных с помощью перенаправленных указателей записей.

item.name: SQLServer:Access Methods: Full Scans / sec
item.description:
Number of unrestricted full scans per second. These can be either base-table or full-index scans.
Количество полных просмотров без ограничений. Это могут быть как просмотры базовой таблицы, так и полные просмотры индекса.

item.name: SQLServer:Access Methods: Index Searches/sec
item.description:
Number of index searches per second. These are used to start a range scan, reposition a range scan, revalidate a scan point, fetch a single index record, and search down the index to locate where to insert a new row.
Количество поисков по индексу. Поиски по индексу используются для запуска просмотров диапазона, выборки отдельных записей индекса, а также для перестановок внутри индекса.

item.name: SQLServer:Access Methods: Page Splits / Sec
item.description:
Number of page splits per second that occur as the result of overflowing index pages.
Количество разбиений страниц в секунду как результат переполнения страниц индекса.

item.name: SQLServer:Access Methods: Workfiles Created/sec
item.description:
Number of work files created per second. For example, work files could be used to store temporary results for hash joins and hash aggregates.
Количество рабочих файлов, создаваемых в секунду. Рабочие файлы могут использоваться, например, для хранения временных результатов хэш-соединений и статистических хэш-выражений.

item.name: SQLServer:Access Methods: Worktables Created/sec
item.description:
Number of work tables created per second. For example, work tables could be used to store temporary results for query spool, lob variables, XML variables, and cursors.
Количество рабочих таблиц, создаваемых в секунду. Рабочие таблицы могут использоваться, например, для хранения временных результатов поиска по запросу, переменных больших объемов, переменных XML и курсоров.

item.name: SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Buffer cache hit ratio
item.description:
Indicates the percentage of pages found in the buffer cache without having to read from disk. The ratio is the total number of cache hits divided by the total number of cache lookups over the last few thousand page accesses. After a long period of time, the ratio moves very little. Because reading from the cache is much less expensive than reading from disk, you want this ratio to be high. Generally, you can increase the buffer cache hit ratio by increasing the amount of memory available to SQL Server or by using the buffer pool extension feature.
Процент найденных в буферном пуле страниц, что исключило необходимость чтения с диска.

trigger.name: SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Buffer cache hit ratio
SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Buffer cache hit ratio

item.name: SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Checkpoint pages/sec
item.description:
Indicates the number of pages flushed to disk per second by a checkpoint or other operation that require all dirty pages to be flushed.
Количество страниц, записанных на диск контрольными точками или другими операциями, для которых необходимо, чтобы все "грязные" страницы были записаны на диск.

item.name: SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Database pages
item.description:
Indicates the number of pages in the buffer pool with database content.
Количество страниц в буферном пуле, занятых содержимым базы данных.

item.name: SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Free list stalls/sec
item.description:
Indicates the number of requests per second that had to wait for a free page.
Количество запросов, ожидающих свободную страницу.

trigger.name: SQLServer: 上下文切换等待队列长度/秒
trigger.description: 值越大说明内存吃紧，性能降低

item.name: SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Lazy writes/sec
item.description:
Indicates the number of buffers written per second by the buffer manager's lazy writer. The lazy writer is a system process that flushes out batches of dirty, aged buffers (buffers that contain changes that must be written back to disk before the buffer can be reused for a different page) and makes them available to user processes. The lazy writer eliminates the need to perform frequent checkpoints in order to create available buffers.
Количество буферов, записанных модулем отложенной записи диспетчера буферов.

item.name: SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Page life expectancy
item.description:
Indicates the number of seconds a page will stay in the buffer pool without references.
Количество секунд, в течение которых страница остается в буферном пуле без ссылок на нее.

trigger.name: SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Page life expectancy

item.name: SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Page lookups/sec
item.description:
Indicates the number of requests per second to find a page in the buffer pool.
Количество запросов на поиск страницы в буферном пуле.

item.name: SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Page reads/sec
item.description:
Indicates the number of physical database page reads that are issued per second. This statistic displays the total number of physical page reads across all databases. Because physical I/O is expensive, you may be able to minimize the cost, either by using a larger data cache, intelligent indexes, and more efficient queries, or by changing the database design.
Количество физических операций чтения страниц базы данных.

item.name: SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Page writes/sec
item.description:
Indicates the number of physical database page writes that are issued per second.
Количество физических операций записи страниц базы данных.

item.name: SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Readahead pages/sec
item.description:
Indicates the number of pages read per second in anticipation of use.
Количество страниц, считанных для упреждения использования.

item.name: SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Target pages
item.description:
The optimum number of pages in the buffer pool.
Оптимальное количество страниц в буферном пуле.

item.name: SQLServer:General Statistics: Logins/sec
item.description:
Total number of logins started per second. This does not include pooled connections.
Общее количество входов в систему, произведенных за секунду.

item.name: SQLServer:General Statistics: Logouts/sec
item.description:
Total number of logout operations started per second.
Общее количество выходов из системы, произведенных за секунду.

item.name: SQLServer:General Statistics: Processes blocked
item.description:
Number of currently blocked processes.
Количество процессов, заблокированных в текущий момент.

item.name: SQLServer:General Statistics: User Connections
item.description:
Counts the number of users currently connected to SQL Server.
Количество пользователей, подключенных к системе.

item.name: SQLServer: Latches: Average Latch Wait Time
item.description:
Average latch wait time (in milliseconds) for latch requests that had to wait.
Среднее время ожидания (мс) для запросов кратковременной блокировки.

item.name: SQLServer: Latches: Latch Waits/sec
item.description:
Number of latch requests that could not be granted immediately.
Количество запросов кратковременной блокировки, которые не удалось выполнить немедленно и которые ожидали перед предоставлением кратковременной блокировки.

item.name: SQLServer: Latches: Total Latch Wait Time
item.description:
Total latch wait time (in milliseconds) for latch requests in the last second.
Общее время ожидания (мс) для запросов кратковременной блокировки в течение последней секунды.

item.name: SQLServer: Locks: Average Wait Time: _Total
item.description:
Total wait time (in milliseconds) for locks in the last second.
Среднее время ожидания (в миллисекундах) для всех ждавших запросов блокировки.

item.name: SQLServer: Locks: Lock Requests/sec: _Total
item.description:
Number of new locks and lock conversions per second requested from the lock manager.
Количество новых блокировок и преобразований блокировок, запрошенных у диспетчера блокировок.

item.name: SQLServer: Locks: Lock Timeouts/sec: _Total
item.description:
Number of lock requests per second that timed out, including requests for NOWAIT locks.
Количество запросов блокировки, время ожидания которых истекло, включая запросы блокировок NOWAIT.

item.name: SQLServer: Locks: Lock Waits / Sec: _Total
item.description:
Number of lock requests per second that required the caller to wait.
Количество запросов блокировки, которые не были выполнены немедленно и ожидали предоставления блокировки.

item.name: SQLServer: Locks: Lock Wait Time: _Total
item.description:
Average amount of wait time (in milliseconds) for each lock request that resulted in a wait.
Общее время ожидания (мс) блокировок за последнюю секунду.

item.name: SQLServer: Locks: Number of Deadlocks/sec: _Total
item.description:
Number of lock requests per second that resulted in a deadlock.
Количество запросов блокировки, приведших к взаимоблокировкам.

item.name: SQLServer:Memory Manager: Granted Workspace Memory
item.description:
Specifies the total amount of memory currently granted to executing processes, such as hash, sort, bulk copy, and index creation operations.
Общий объем памяти, выделенной выполняющимся процессам. Эта память используется для операций хэширования, сортировки и создания курсоров.

item.name: SQLServer:Memory Manager: Maximum Workspace Memory
item.description:
Indicates the maximum amount of memory available for executing processes, such as hash, sort, bulk copy, and index creation operations.
Общий объем памяти, доступный для выделения выполняющимся процессам. Эта память используется главным образом для хэширования, сортировки и создания операций с индексами.

item.name: SQLServer:Memory Manager: Memory Grants Outstanding
item.description:
Specifies the total number of processes that have successfully acquired a workspace memory grant.
Текущее количество процессов, успешно получивших память для рабочего пространства

item.name: SQLServer:Memory Manager: Memory Grants Pending
item.description:
Specifies the total number of processes waiting for a workspace memory grant.
Текущее количество процессов, ожидающих выделения памяти под рабочее пространство

item.name: SQLServer:Memory Manager: Target Server Memory
item.description:
Indicates the ideal amount of memory the server can consume.
Объем памяти, необходимой серверу в идеальном случае

item.name: SQLServer:Memory Manager: Total Server Memory
item.description:
Specifies the amount of memory the server has committed using the memory manager.
Общий объем динамической памяти, используемой сервером в данный момент.

item.name: SQLServer:Plan Cache: Cache Hit Ratio
item.description:
Ratio between cache hits and lookups.
Соотношение между попаданиями в кэш и обращениями к кэшу.

item.name: SQLServer:Plan Cache: Cache Object Counts
item.description:
Number of cache objects in the cache.
Количество объектов в кэше.

item.name: SQLServer:Plan Cache: Cache Objects in use
item.description:
Number of cache objects in use.
Количество используемых объектов кэша.

item.name: SQLServer:Plan Cache: Cache Pages
item.description:
Number of 8-kilobyte (KB) pages used by cache objects.
Количество страниц объемом 8 КБ, используемых объектами кэша

item.name: SQLServer: SQL Errors: Errors/sec (DB Offline Errors)
item.description:
Number of errors/sec.
Количество ошибок/с

item.name: SQLServer: SQL Errors: Errors/sec (Info Errors)
item.description:
Number of errors/sec.
Количество ошибок/с

item.name: SQLServer: SQL Errors: Errors/sec (Kill Connection Errors)
item.description:
Number of errors/sec.
Количество ошибок/с

item.name: SQLServer: SQL Errors: Errors/sec (User Errors)
item.description:
Number of errors/sec.
Количество ошибок/с

item.name: SQLServer: SQL Errors: Errors/sec (_Total)
item.description:
Number of errors/sec.
Количество ошибок/с

item.name: SQLServer:SQL Statistics: Auto-Param Attempts/sec
item.description:
Number of auto-parameterization attempts per second. Total should be the sum of the failed, safe, and unsafe auto-parameterizations. Auto-parameterization occurs when an instance of SQL Server tries to parameterize a Transact-SQL request by replacing some literals with parameters so that reuse of the resulting cached execution plan across multiple similar-looking requests is possible. Note that auto-parameterizations are also known as simple parameterizations in newer versions of SQL Server. This counter does not include forced parameterizations.
Количество попыток автоматической параметризации.

item.name: SQLServer:SQL Statistics: Batch Requests/Sec
item.description:
Number of Transact-SQL command batches received per second. This statistic is affected by all constraints (such as I/O, number of users, cache size, complexity of requests, and so on). High batch requests mean good throughput.
Количество пакетных запросов SQL, полученных сервером.

item.name: SQLServer:SQL Statistics: Failed Auto-Params/sec
item.description:
Number of failed auto-parameterization attempts per second. This should be small. Note that auto-parameterizations are also known as simple parameterizations in later versions of SQL Server.
Количество сбоев, произошедших при автоматической параметризации.

item.name: SQLServer:SQL Statistics: Safe Auto-Params/sec
item.description:
Number of safe auto-parameterization attempts per second. Safe refers to a determination that a cached execution plan can be shared between different similar-looking Transact-SQL statements. SQL Server makes many auto-parameterization attempts some of which turn out to be safe and others fail. Note that auto-parameterizations are also known as simple parameterizations in later versions of SQL Server. This does not include forced parameterizations.
Количество безопасных попыток автоматической параметризации.

item.name: SQLServer:SQL Statistics: SQL Compilations/Sec
item.description:
Number of SQL compilations per second. Indicates the number of times the compile code path is entered. Includes compiles caused by statement-level recompilations in SQL Server. After SQL Server user activity is stable, this value reaches a steady state.
Количество компиляций SQL.

item.name: SQLServer:SQL Statistics: SQL Re-Compilations/sec
item.description:
Number of statement recompiles per second. Counts the number of times statement recompiles are triggered. Generally, you want the recompiles to be low.
Количество повторных компиляций SQL.

item.name: SQLServer:SQL Statistics: Unsafe Auto-Params/sec
item.description:
Number of unsafe auto-parameterization attempts per second. For example, the query has some characteristics that prevent the cached plan from being shared. These are designated as unsafe. This does not count the number of forced parameterizations.
Количество небезопасных попыток автоматической параметризации.

item_prototype.name: SQLServer:Databases: Active Transactions {#DBNAME}
item_prototype.description:
Number of active transactions for the database.
Количество активных транзакций обновления в базе данных.

item_prototype.name: SQLServer:Databases: Data File(s) Size {#DBNAME}
item_prototype.description:
Cumulative size (in kilobytes) of all the data files in the database including any automatic growth. Monitoring this counter is useful, for example, for determining the correct size of tempdb.
Совокупный размер всех файлов данных в базе данных.

item_prototype.name: SQLServer:Databases: Log Bytes Flushed/sec {#DBNAME}
item_prototype.description:
Total number of log bytes flushed per second. Useful for determining trends and utilization of the transaction log
Общее количество байтов журнала, сброшенных на диск.

item_prototype.name: SQLServer:Databases: Log File(s) Size {#DBNAME}
item_prototype.description:
Cumulative size (in kilobytes) of all the transaction log files in the database.
Совокупный размер файлов всех журналов в базе данных.

item_prototype.name: SQLServer:Databases: Log File(s) Used Size {#DBNAME}
item_prototype.description:
The cumulative used size of all the log files in the database.
Совокупный используемый размер файлов всех журналов в базе данных.

item_prototype.name: SQLServer:Databases: Log Flushes/sec {#DBNAME}
item_prototype.description:
Number of log flushes per second.
Количество сбрасываний журнала на диск.

item_prototype.name: SQLServer:Databases: Log Flush Waits/sec {#DBNAME}
item_prototype.description:
Number of commits per second waiting for the log flush.
Количество точек фиксации, ожидающих сброса журнала на диск.

item_prototype.name: SQLServer:Databases: Log Flush Wait Time {#DBNAME}
item_prototype.description:
Total wait time (in milliseconds) to flush the log. On an AlwaysOn secondary database, this value indicates the wait time for log records to be hardened to disk.
Общее время ожидания (в миллисекундах).

item_prototype.name: SQLServer:Databases: Log Growths {#DBNAME}
item_prototype.description:
Total number of times the transaction log for the database has been expanded.
Общее количество увеличений журнала для этой базы данных.

item_prototype.name: SQLServer:Databases: Log Shrinks {#DBNAME}
item_prototype.description:
Total number of times the transaction log for the database has been shrunk.
Общее количество сжатий журнала для этой базы данных.

item_prototype.name: SQLServer:Databases: Log Truncations {#DBNAME}
item_prototype.description:
The number of times the transaction log has been shrunk.
Общее количество усечений журнала для этой базы данных.

item_prototype.name: SQLServer:Databases: Percent Log Used {#DBNAME}
item_prototype.description:
Percentage of space in the log that is in use.
Процентная доля используемого пространства журнала.

template.template: Template OS Windows Discovery Performance Monitoring
template.name: Template OS Windows Discovery Performance Monitoring

item.name: Memory % Committed Bytes in Use
item.description: This measures the ratio of Committed Bytes to the Commit Limit—in other words, the amount of virtual memory in use. This indicates insufficient memory if the number is greater than 80 percent. The obvious solution for this is to add more memory.

trigger.name: swap Memory usage exceeded 90%
trigger.description: This measures the ratio of Committed Bytes to the Commit Limit—in other words, the amount of virtual memory in use. This indicates insufficient memory if the number is greater than 80 percent. The obvious solution for this is to add more memory.

item.name: Memory Pool Nonpaged Bytes
item.description: This measures the size, in bytes, of the non-paged pool. This is an area of system memory for objects that cannot be written to disk but instead must remain in physical memory as long as they are allocated. There is a possible memory leak if the value is greater than 175MB (or 100MB with the /3GB switch). A typical Event ID 2019 is recorded in the system event log.

item.name: Memory Pool Paged Bytes
item.description: This measures the size, in bytes, of the paged pool. This is an area of system memory used for objects that can be written to disk when they are not being used. There may be a memory leak if this value is greater than 250MB (or 170MB with the /3GB switch). A typical Event ID 2020 is recorded in the system event log.

item.name: IO Data Operations/sec
item.description: These counters count all I/O activity generated to include file, network and device I/Os. These analyses check when processes are doing more than 1,000 I/O’s per second and flag it as a warning. These analyses are best used in correlation with other analyses such as disk analysis to determine which processes might be involved in the I/O activity.

item.name: IO Other Operations/sec
item.description: The number of input/output operations generated by a process that are neither reads nor writes, including file, network, and device I/Os. An example of this type of operation would be a control function. I/O Others directed to CONSOLE (console input object) handles are not counted.

item.name: IO Read Operations/sec
item.description: The number of read input/output operations generated by a process, including file, network, and device I/Os. I/O Reads directed to CONSOLE (console input object) handles are not counted.

item.name: IO Write Operations/sec
item.description: The number of write input/output operations generated by a process, including file, network, and device I/Os. I/O Writes directed to CONSOLE (console input object) handles are not counted.

item.name: Processor % C1 Time
item.description: C1 is a power saving mode in a CPU. This counter keeps track of how often the process is able to enter a power saving state when idle. So %C1 Time is the percentage of time the LP is in the C1 state and for _Total the average percentage across all LP.

item.name: Processor % C2 Time
item.description: C2 is a power saving mode in a CPU, deeper than C1. This counter keeps track of how often the process is able to enter a power saving state when idle. So %C2 Time is the percentage of time the LP is in the C2 state and for _Total the average percentage across all LP.

item.name: Processor % C3 Time
item.description: C3 is a power saving mode in a CPU, deeper than both C1 and C2. This counter keeps track of how often the process is able to enter a power saving state when idle. So %C3 Time is the percentage of time the LP is in the C3 state and for _Total the average percentage across all LP.

item.name: Processor % DPC Time
item.description: Determines how much time the processor is spending processing DPCs. DPCs originate when the processor performs tasks requiring immediate attention, and then defers the remainder of the task to be handled at lower priority. DPCs represent further processing of client requests.

item.name: Processor % Interrupt Time
item.description: This measures the time the processor spends receiving and servicing hardware interruptions during specific sample intervals. This counter indicates a possible hardware issue if the value is greater than 15 percent.

item.name: Processor % Privileged Time
item.description: The percentage of time a thread was running in privileged mode.

item.name: Processor ％ User Time
item.description: This measures the percentage of elapsed time the processor spends in user mode. If this value is high, the server is busy with the application. One possible solution here is to optimize the application that is using up the processor resources.

item.name: Context Switches/sec
item.description: Indicates that the kernel has switched the thread it is running on a processor. A context switch occurs each time a new thread runs, and each time one thread takes over from another. A large number of threads is likely to increase the number of context switches. Context switches allow multiple threads to share time slices on the processors, but they also interrupt the processor and might reduce overall system performance, especially on multiprocessor computers. You should also observe the patterns of context switches over time.

discovery_rule.name: LogicalDisk Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovers logical disks (e.g. partitions C:\, E:\, etc.).

item_prototype.name: LogicalDisk {#DISKNUMLET} Avg. Disk Read Queue Length
LogicalDisk {#DISKNUMLET} Avg. Disk Write Queue Length

discovery_rule.name: Network Interface Discovery
discovery_rule.description:
Discovers network interfaces.
The regex 1 » (Loopback|Miniport|Microsoft|RAS|QoS|WFP|Tunneling|isatap) [Result is FALSE]
will filter logical interfaces created by the Windows OS.

discovery_rule.description: Discovers Physical Disks (e.g. disks, RAID arrays, etc.).

item_prototype.name: PhysicalDisk {#DISKNUMLET} Avg. Disk Read Queue Length
PhysicalDisk {#DISKNUMLET} Avg. Disk Write Queue Length

trigger.expression: {Template MS SQL 2012 Monitoring:perf_counter["\SQLServer:Access Methods\Forwarded Records/sec",30].last()}>{Template MS SQL 2012 Monitoring:perf_counter["\SQLServer:SQL Statistics\Batch Requests/sec",30].last()}/10
trigger.name: SQLServer:Access Methods: Forwarded Records/sec

trigger.expression: {Template MS SQL 2012 Monitoring:perf_counter["\SQLServer:Access Methods\Page Splits/sec",30].last()}>{Template MS SQL 2012 Monitoring:perf_counter["\SQLServer:SQL Statistics\Batch Requests/sec",30].last()}/5
trigger.name: SQLServer:Access Methods Page Splits / Sec

SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Buffer cache hit ratio
SQLServer: Buffer Manager: Free list stalls/sec
